UP Police ASI 2021 Syllabus

 

UP Police ASI Syllabus 2021: Uttar Pradesh Police Recruitment & Promotion Board (UPPRPB) has released an official notice regarding the recruitment of candidates to the Sub Inspector and Assistant Sub Inspector post. The number of vacancies for UP Police ASI & SI is 1329. The online application has begun on 1st June 2021 and the last date to apply is 15th July 2021

Uttar Pradesh Police Recruitment & Promotion Board

(UPPRPB)

UP Police ASI Syllabus

WWW.sarkariresult.com-in.online

 

UP Police ASI Exam Pattern

As per the notification, the selection of the candidates will be made on the basis of their performance in the following three stages:

  1. Online Written Exam
  2. Documentation & Physical Standard Test (PST)
  3. Physical Efficiency Test (PET)

The detail of the UP Police ASI exam pattern for the written exam is mentioned below: –

Subject Maximum Marks
General Hindi/ Computer Knowledge 100
Law/ Constitution and General Knowledge 100
Numerical & Mental Ability Test 100
Mental Aptitude Test/Intelligence Test/Test of Reasoning 100
Total 400
  • The online written exam will be of an objective type.
  • The total number of marks for the exam is 400 marks.
  • No negative marking for the wrong answer.
  • The Question Paper is in both Hindi and English language except for the General Hindi part.

There are Criteria of Minimum Qualifying Marks i

  • Sectional Cutoff – 35%
  • Overall Cutoff – 40%

UP Police ASI Syllabus

UP Police ASI Syllabus 2021 detail is available here for interested candidates to help them in their preparation for the exam. The UP Police ASI Selection Process comprises of Written Exam, Document Verification & PET/ PST, Computer Typing/ Stenography Test, Medical Test, and Character Verification. The syllabus for the written examination consists of General Hindi, General Knowledge, Numerical & Mental Ability Test, and Mental Aptitude /Intelligence /Reasoning. The detailed UP Police ASI syllabus and topics have been mentioned below-

Subjects Topics Included
General Hindi
  • Hindi & Other Indian languages/ हिंदी और अन्य भारतीय भाषाएँ
  • Hindi Grammar/ हिंदी व्याकरण
  • Antonym, Synonym/एंटोनियम, पर्यायवाची
  • One word Substitution/एकार्थी शब्द
  • Comprehension
  • Tatasam and tadbhav/तत्सम एवं तदभव
  • वाक्यांशों के लिए शब्द निर्माण
  • लोकोक्तियाँ एवं मुहावरे
  • त्रुटि से सम्बंधित अनेकार्थी शब्द
  • वर्तनी
  • वाक्य संशोधन
  • कारक
  • लिंग
  • वचन
Numerical Ability 
  • Number System
  • Simplification
  • HCF LCM
  • Use of Table & Graph
  • Decimal & Fraction
  • Compound and Simple Interest
  • Partnership
  • Profit & Loss, Discount
  • Time & Work, Distance
  • Ratio & Proportion
  • Percentage
  • Mensuration & Miscellaneous
Mental Ability 
  • Logical Diagrams
  • Symbol-Relationship Interpretation
  • Codification Perception Test
  • Word formation Test
  • Letter and number series
  • Word and alphabet
  • Analogy
  •  Common Sense Test
  • Letter and number coding
  • Direction sense Test
  • Logical interpretation of data
  • Forcefulness of argument
  • Determining implied meanings
Basic Law
  • Human Rights
  • Traffic Rules
  • National Security Issues
  • Principle of Crime Punishment
  • Right of Self Defence
  • General Knowledge about Law
  • General Knowledge about Indian Constitution
  • Aim of the Constitution
  • Fundamental Rights
  • Directive principles
  • Rules & Regulations of constitutional Amendments
  • All India Service
  • Information about social Law related to women children
  • Reservation of SC/ ST, Environment
  • Wild Life Conservation
General Knowledge
  • General Science
  • Award and Honours
  • Books and Authors
  • Current Affairs of National & International Importance
  • Indian Politics & Economics
  • Questions from the events that happen in daily life especially from the perspective of General Science.
  • Indian History: Focus will be on Knowledge of Financial, Social, Religious & Political Parties. Under the Indian Freedom Movement knowledge about Nature & Specialty of Indian Freedom Movement, Rise of nationalism & How we get Freedom is expected.
  • World Geography: General Knowledge will be tested about the Physical/ Ecology of India, Economical, Social, Demographic Issues.
Mental Aptitude
  • Law and order
  • Communal harmony
  • Crime Control
  • Rule of law
  • Ability of Adaptability
  • Professional Information (Basic level)
  • Police System
  • Contemporary Police Issues & Law and order
  • Basic Law
  • Interest in Profession
  • Mental toughness
  • Sensitivity towards minorities and underprivileged
  • Gender sensitivity
Intelligence Quotient
  • Relationship and Analogy Test
  • Spotting out the dissimilar
  • Series Completion
  • Coding-Decoding
  • Direction Sense Test
  • Blood Relation
  • Problems based on the alphabet
  • Time sequence test
  • Venn Diagram and chart type test
  • Mathematical ability Test
  • Arranging in order
Reasoning
  • Visual memory
  • Discrimination
  • Analogies
  • Similarities
  • Differences
  • Space visualization
  • Observation, Relationship
  • Concepts
  • Arithmetical reasoning
  • Verbal and figure classification
  • Arithmetical number series
  • Abilities to deal with abstract ideas and symbols and their relationships
  • Arithmetical computations and other analytical functions
  • Problem-solving
  • Analysis and Judgment
  • Decision-making.

UP Police ASI Physical Standard Test

The candidates will be called for the UP Police ASI Physical Standard Test after qualifying written exam. The following criteria have to be met to qualify PST-

Category Height Chest
Male Gen/ OBC/ SC 168 cms 79-84 cms
ST 160 cms 77-82 cms
Female Gen/ OBC/ SC 152 cms N/A
ST 147 cms N/A

US Police ASI Physical Efficiency Test (PET)

The candidates have to go through the Physical Efficiency Test after qualifying Physical standard Test. The candidates have to cover a certain distance in a specific time period, as mentioned below: –

Race –

  • Male – 4.8 km in 28 minutes.
  • Female – 2.4 km in 16 minutes.

Interested Candidates can visit the official website or Read the Notification for exam patterns and syllabus.

For Online Apply: Click here

FAQ

What is the selection process for the post of UP Police ASI?

The UP Police ASI Selection Process comprises of Written Exam, Document Verification & PET/ PST, Computer Typing/ Stenography Test, Medical Test, and Character Verification.

What are the subjects as per the UP Police ASI Syllabus?

The syllabus for the written examination consists of General Hindi, General Knowledge, Numerical & Mental Ability Test, and Mental Aptitude /Intelligence /Reasoning. Detail here

What is the time duration for the UP Police ASI written examination 2021?

The duration for the UP Police ASI written exam 2021 is 02 hours. 

Is there a negative marking for any of the wrong answers in the UP Police ASI Exam 2021?

No, there is not any negative marking for wrong answer marked.

How to apply for UP Police ASI 2021 Exam?

The online application process for UP Police ASI 2021 exam has been begun on June 1, 2021. The link to Apply Online for UP Police ASI 2021 is here.
